alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Essex; Eastern Hanover; Eastern King and Queen; Western Essex; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 06 at 8:03PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN KING AND QUEEN... SOUTHEASTERN CAROLINE...EAST CENTRAL HANOVER...NORTHWESTERN KING WILLIAM AND CENTRAL ESSEX COUNTIES THROUGH 845 PM EDT... At 803 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Dawn, or 9 miles northeast of Ashland, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Mangohick around 810 PM EDT. Beulahville around 815 PM EDT. Newtown around 825 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Beazley, Enfield, Central Garage, Owenton, Upshaw, Etna Mills, Rexburg, Epworth, Biscoe, and Calno. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
